page.title: 06FIELD BOUNDARIES:MILDENHALL
page.content: In the whole of our area there are about 29145 metres of{hedge.}About half of this is managed by slashing or clipping.There are no field boundaries which are walls.The most common species of{plants}present in our hedges are Dogwood, Ash, Field maple, Hazel, and Blackthorn. Apart from hedges there are about 10461 metres of{fence.}Most of this is barbed wire.Since the last survey there have been about 1404 metres of fence or hedge constructed or grown in this area, and about 1250 metres of field boundary has disappeared. Some of the hedges have recently been planted, but some are very old.The oldest hedge in our area is 1200 years old.This can be worked out by counting the number of species in a certain length of hedgerow.
